events.message: The insured reported a vehicle collision that happened on the morning of April 30th. The car sustained front bumper damage following a rear-end accident.
The claim has been reviewed and categorized under 'Auto Accident' due to the type of incident involving a passenger vehicle collision.
A claims agent was assigned to the case to ensure timely processing and provide the insured with guidance throughout the claim process.
The insured was sent a formal acknowledgment confirming receipt of the auto accident claim and explaining the upcoming steps in the process.
The claims team requested detailed repair estimates, police accident reports, and photos of vehicle damage to proceed with claim investigation.
The insured promptly submitted all required documents, including the police report and repair quotes, enabling the investigation to move forward.
Investigators began reviewing the submitted evidence and contacted witnesses to verify the circumstances surrounding the car accident.
The investigation concluded that the insured was not at fault, based on evidence provided and police statements, confirming the validity of the claim.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover full repair costs along with rental car reimbursement while the vehicle is repaired.
The insured expressed appreciation for the efficient handling and clear communication throughout the claims process.
The claim was formally approved with authorization for immediate payment to the repair shop for scheduled vehicle repairs.
Payment was successfully issued to the authorized service center, covering the total cost of repairs as per the approved settlement.
The claim was closed after the insured confirmed that the vehicle repairs were completed satisfactorily and all billed amounts settled.
